greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2) + a(n-3), a(0)=3, a(1)=1, a(2)=3.
comment: For n >= 3, a(n) is the number of cyclic sequences consisting of n zeros and ones that do not contain three consecutive ones provided the positions of the zeros and ones are fixed on a circle. This is proved in Charalambides (1991) and Zhang and Hadjicostas (2015). For example, a(3)=7 because only the sequences 110, 101, 011, 001, 010, 100 and 000 avoid three consecutive ones. (For n=1,2 the statement is still true provided we allow the sequence to wrap around itself on a circle.) - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Dec 16 2016
For n >= 3, also the number of dominating sets on the n-cycle graph C_n. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Mar 30 2017
For n >= 3, also the number of minimal dominating sets and maximal irredundant sets on the n-sun graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jul 28 and Aug 17 2017
For n >= 3, also the number of minimal edge covers in the n-web graph. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Aug 03 2017
For n >= 1, also the number of ways to tile a bracelet of length n with squares, dominos, and trominos. - _Ruijia Li_ and _Greg Dresden_, Sep 14 2019

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,1).
formula: Binet's formula: a(n) = r1^n + r2^n + r3^n, where r1, r2, r3 are the roots of the characteristic polynomial 1 + x + x^2 - x^3, see A058265.
a(n) = n*Sum_{k=1..n} (Sum_{j=n-3*k..k} binomial(j, n-3*k+2*j)* binomial(k,j))/k), n > 0, a(0)=3. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Feb 24 2011
a(n) = A073145(-n). for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 17 2016
maple: A001644:=-(1+2*z+3*z**2)/(z**3+z**2+z-1); # _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation; gives sequence except for the initial 3
mathematica: a[n_]:= n*Sum[Sum[Binomial[j, n-3*k+2*j]*Binomial[k, j], {j,n-3*k,k}]/k, {k, n}]; a[0] = 3; Array[a, 40, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 24 2011 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, polsym(1 - x - x^2 - x^3, -n)[-n+1], polsym(1 + x + x^2 - x^3, n)[n+1])}; /* _Michael Somos_, Nov 02 2002 */
(MAGMA) I:=[3,1,3]; [n le 3 select I[n] else Self(n-1)+Self(n-2)+ Self(n-3): n in [1..40]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2017
(GAP) a:=[3,1,3];; for n in [4..40] do a[n]:=a[n-1]+a[n-2]+a[n-3]; od; a; # _Muniru A Asiru_, Dec 18 2018
xref: Cf. A000073, A073145, A106293 (Pisano periods), A073728 (partial sums).
